Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.io

Class SwapOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
nl.naturalis.common.io.SwapOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArraySwapOutputStream, NioSwapOutputStream
public abstract class SwapOutputStream
extends OutputStream
An OutputStream that allows allows you to read back the data that were written to it. Data written to a SwapOutputStream first fills up an internal buffer. If (and only if) the buffer reaches full capacity, a swap file is created to sink the data into. Thus whatever the amount of data written to the SwapOutputStream, it can always be recalled. It is transparent to clients whether or not data has actually been swapped out of memory. Clients can recall the data without having to know whether it came from the internal buffer or from the swap file.

SwapOutputStream and its subclasses are not thread-safe. Except for the cleanup() method all method calls need to be synchronized using a lock on the entire instance (or something equivalently exclusive).

SwapOutputStream and its subclasses effectively are a sort of BufferedOutputStream. Therefore, with respect to performance, it is pointless to wrap a SwapOutputStream into a BufferedOutputStream.

Author:
Ayco Holleman

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description

    Deletes the swap file, if it was created.
    abstract void close()
    If created and still open, this method closes the OutputStream or FileChannel writing to the swap file.

    If a swap file had to be created and no recall has taken place yet, this method flushes the output stream to the swap file.
    abstract void forceFlush()
    For the non-java.nio implementations of SwapOutputStream this method behaves exactly like flush().

      Parameters:

    • SwapOutputStream

      Parameters:

      bufSize - The size in bytes of the internal buffer

  • Method Details

    • recall

      public abstract void recall​(OutputStream target) throws IOException
      Collects the data written to this instance and writes it to the specified target. You can continue writing data to the SwapOutputStream even after the data has been recalled. The SwapOutputStream tacitly closes the output stream to the swap file (if data had to be swapped out of the internal buffer) and turns itself into a BufferedOutputStream around the specified target output stream. This method can be called only once. Subsequent calls result in an IOException.
      Parameters:
      target - The output stream to which to write the data
      Throws:
      IOException - If you call this method more than once or if an I/O error occurs

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Deletes the swap file, if it was created. Can be called if, after the data has been recalled, the swap file is no longer needed. You might also want to call this method in the catch block of an exception.

    • flush

      public abstract void flush() throws IOException
      If a swap file had to be created and no recall has taken place yet, this method flushes the output stream to the swap file. After the data has been recalled this method flushes the output stream passed in through the recall method. The java.nio implementations of SwapOutputStream will not call force on the FileChannel writing to the swap file. Call forceFlush() if necessary.
      Specified by:
      flush in interface Flushable
      Overrides:
      flush in class OutputStream
      Throws:
      IOException

    • forceFlush

      public abstract void forceFlush() throws IOException
      For the non-java.nio implementations of SwapOutputStream this method behaves exactly like flush(). For the java.nio implementations of SwapOutputStream this method will call ileChannel#force(boolean) force(false)} on the FileChannel writing to the swap file.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      public abstract void close() throws IOException
      If created and still open, this method closes the OutputStream or FileChannel writing to the swap file. Note that the recall method tacitly closes the OutputStream c.q. FileChannel before it starts reading the swap file. The close method will not close the output stream passed in through the recall method. Thus you can safely keep using that output stream outside the try-with-resources block for a SwapOutputStream.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class OutputStream
      Throws:
      IOException

    • hasSwapped

      public abstract boolean hasSwapped()
      Returns whether or not a swap file was created. You should not normally need to call this method as swapping is taken care of automatically, but it could be useful for debug or logging purposes.
